revised_title: Fifty Years of Light Scattering Studies in Gases, Liquids, and Solids
tldr: This article discusses the significant impact of light scattering studies in physics, chemistry, and biology since the discovery of the Raman effect in 1928. The advancements in technique and theory have extended the applications of light scattering to various fields. The use of laser sources has revolutionized the field, promising more precise measurements of molecular structures and dynamics, and new applications and knowledge.
